questions.question: What is the full name of the synthesized material in the study?
What is the primary application of the synthesized material according to the study?
questions.answer: As a solid support for enzyme immobilization

questions.question: What enzymes were immobilized using the synthesized material in the study?
What method was used to synthesize the material?
What is the space group of the synthesized material?
How does the enzyme activity of MP-11@Cu-POMCOF compare to free MP-11 in water?
questions.answer: MP-11@Cu-POMCOF exhibits significantly higher catalytic activity than free MP-11 in water.

questions.question: What is the effect of organic solvents on the enzyme activity of immobilized enzymes compared to free enzymes?
questions.answer: Immobilized enzymes exhibit higher stability and retain more activity in organic solvents compared to free enzymes.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesized material exhibits excellent stability in aqueous solutions under different pH conditions.
What is the crystal system of the synthesized material?
True or False: The study found that enzyme immobilization on the synthesized material leads to a decrease in enzyme activity.
What technique was used to analyze the powder of the synthesized material?
True or False: The synthesized material's structure allows for the transport of substrate and product molecules without impacting enzyme catalytic efficiency.
What was the observed effect on enzyme activity when the reaction buffer was changed to an aqueous system?
questions.answer: The immobilized enzymes exhibited significantly higher catalytic activity in an aqueous system compared to sodium citrate buffer.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesized material's structure is suitable for enzyme attachment through ionic bonds.
What was the main challenge with enzyme applications that the study aimed to overcome?
questions.answer: The low thermal stability and difficult recovery of enzymes

questions.question: True or False: The study demonstrated that the synthesized material could only immobilize small enzymes.
How does the thermal stability of immobilized enzymes compare to free enzymes according to the study?
questions.answer: Immobilized enzymes exhibit significantly higher thermal stability than free enzymes.

questions.question: What was the method used to determine the uptake capacity of enzymes by the synthesized material?
questions.answer: By measuring the amount of protein reduced in the supernatant using a BCA assay.

questions.question: True or False: The study found that immobilized enzymes could not be recycled for further use.
What was the observed effect of enzyme immobilization on enzyme stability in organic buffers?
questions.answer: Enzyme immobilization significantly increased enzyme stability in organic buffers.
